head.supplied: Melbourne, 3rd April 1883 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of Fifty pounds (£50) from the vote for "Paper for Lithograms" to the vote...

div.p: Z83/3250, unit 1406, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 3rd April 1883

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of Fifty pounds (£50) from the vote for "Paper for Lithograms" to the vote for Publication of Works" also of the sum of Eighty pounds (£80) from the vote for "Collector of Plants" to the vote for "Books, Botanical Collections and Incidental Expenses", in order to enable me to meet the necessary expenditure under the above headings for the current financial year.

div.p: I have the honor to be
